metadata.title: CVE-2019-17008 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When using nested workers, a use-after-free could occur during worker destruction. This resulted in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, Firefox ESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-17008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.3.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
